Detailed Description

Defines the interface to the dedisp library.

dedisp is a C library for computing the incoherent dedispersion transform using a GPU. It takes filterbank data as input and computes multiple dedispersed integrated time series at different dispersion measures. The application programming interface (API) is based on that of the FFTW library, and should be familiar to users of that package.

Bug:
Asynchronous execution is not currently operational.

Typedef Documentation

dedisp_bool

The boolean data-type used by the library. Note that this type is implementation-defined and may not be equivalent to 'bool'.

dedisp_byte

The byte data-type used by the library to store time-series data.

dedisp_float

The floating-point data-type used by the library. This is currently guaranteed to be equivalent to 'float'.

dedisp_plan

The plan type used by the library to reference a dedispersion plan. This is an opaque pointer type.

dedisp_size

The size data-type used by the library to store sizes/dimensions.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum dedisp_error

Error codes for the library:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR: No error occurred.
DEDISP_MEM_ALLOC_FAILED: A memory allocation failed.
DEDISP_MEM_COPY_FAILED: A memory copy failed. This is often due to one of the arrays passed to dedisp_execute being too small.
DEDISP_NCHANS_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: The number of channels exceeds the internal limit. The current limit is 8192.
DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN: The given plan is NULL.
DEDISP_INVALID_POINTER: A pointer is invalid, possibly NULL.
DEDISP_INVALID_STRIDE: A stride value is less than the corresponding dimension's size.
DEDISP_NO_DM_LIST_SET: No DM list has yet been set using either dedisp_set_dm_list or dedisp_generate_dm_list.
DEDISP_TOO_FEW_NSAMPS: The number of time samples is less than the maximum dedispersion delay.
DEDISP_INVALID_FLAG_COMBINATION: Some of the given flags are incompatible.
DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_IN_NBITS: The given in_nbits value is not supported. See dedisp_execute for supported values.
DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_OUT_NBITS: The given out_nbits value is not supported. See dedisp_execute for supported values.
DEDISP_INVALID_DEVICE_INDEX: The given device index does not correspond to a device in the system.
DEDISP_DEVICE_ALREADY_SET: The device has already been set and cannot be changed. See dedisp_set_device for more info.
DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR: There was an existing GPU error prior to calling the function.
DEDISP_INTERNAL_GPU_ERROR: An unexpected GPU error has occurred within the library. Please contact the authors if you get this error.
DEDISP_UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact the authors if you get this error.

enum dedisp_flag

Flags for the library:
DEDISP_USE_DEFAULT: Use the default settings.
DEDISP_HOST_POINTERS: Instruct the function that the given pointers point to memory on the host.
DEDISP_DEVICE_POINTERS: Instruct the function that the given pointers point to memory on the device.
DEDISP_WAIT: Instruct the function to wait until all device operations are complete before returning.
DEDISP_ASYNC: Instruct the function to return before all device operations are complete.

Function Documentation

dedisp_error dedisp_create_plan ( dedisp_plan *  plan,
dedisp_size  nchans,
dedisp_float  dt,
dedisp_float  f0,
dedisp_float  df 
)

dedisp_create_plan builds a new plan object using the given parameters and returns it in *plan.

Parameters:
planPointer to a dedisp_plan object
nchansNumber of frequency channels
dtTime difference between two consecutive samples in seconds
f0Frequency of the first (i.e., highest frequency) channel in MHz
dfFrequency difference between two consecutive channels in MHz
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_NCHANS_EXCEEDS_LIMIT, DEDISP_MEM_ALLOC_FAILED, DEDISP_MEM_COPY_FAILED, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
void dedisp_destroy_plan ( dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_destroy_plan frees a plan and its associated resources

Parameters:
planPlan object to destroy
dedisp_error dedisp_disable_adaptive_dt ( dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_disable_adaptive_dt disables adaptive time resolution for plan.

Parameters:
planThe plan for which to disable adaptive time resolution.
dedisp_error dedisp_enable_adaptive_dt ( dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_float  pulse_width,
dedisp_float  tol 
)

dedisp_enable_adaptive_dt instructs plan to use an adaptive time-resolution scheme. The time resolution is varied as a function of DM, decreasing by factors of 2 when the increase in smearing is below tol.

Parameters:
planThe plan for which to enable adaptive time resolution.
pulse_widthThe expected pulse width in microseconds (used to determine the total smearing).
tolThe smearing tolerance at which the time resolution is reduced. A typical value is 1.15, meaning a tolerance of 15%.
dedisp_error dedisp_execute ( const dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_size  nsamps,
const dedisp_byte *  in,
dedisp_size  in_nbits,
dedisp_byte *  out,
dedisp_size  out_nbits,
unsigned  flags 
)

dedisp_execute executes a plan to dedisperse the given array of data.

Parameters:
planThe plan to execute.
nsampsThe length in samples of each input time series.
inPointer to an array containing a time series of length nsamps for each frequency channel in plan. The data must be in time-major order, i.e., frequency is the fastest-changing dimension, time the slowest. There must be no padding between consecutive frequency channels.
in_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the input data. Currently supported values are: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32
outPointer to an output array of length (nsamps - max_delay) * dm_count * out_nbits/8 bytes, where max_delay and dm_count are the values given by dedisp_get_max_delay(plan) and dedisp_get_dm_count(plan). The output order is DM-major, i.e., time is the fastest-changing dimension, DM the slowest.
out_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the output data. Currently supported values are: 8 (uchar), 16 (ushort), 32 (float)
flagsConfiguration flags, interpreted as follows:
0 or DEDISP_USE_DEFAULT: Use the default configuration.
DEDISP_HOST_POINTERS (default): The pointers in and out point to arrays on the host.
DEDISP_DEVICE_POINTERS: The pointers in and out point to arrays on the device.
DEDISP_WAIT (default): Force the function to wait until the computation is complete before returning.
DEDISP_ASYNC: Allow the function to return before the computation is complete. The dedisp_sync function can later be used to wait until the computation is complete.
Flags may be combined using the | operator.
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_INVALID_POINTER, DEDISP_INVALID_STRIDE, DEDISP_NO_DM_LIST_SET, DEDISP_TOO_FEW_NSAMPS, DEDISP_INVALID_FLAG_COMBINATION, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_IN_NBITS, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_OUT_NBITS, DEDISP_INTERNAL_GPU_ERROR, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
Note:
This function assumes in and out are unpadded arrays. To process arrays containing padding, use dedisp_execute_adv.
This function assumes one wishes to compute all DMs in the DM list. To compute only a subset of the DM list, use dedisp_execute_guru.
dedisp_error dedisp_execute_adv ( const dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_size  nsamps,
const dedisp_byte *  in,
dedisp_size  in_nbits,
dedisp_size  in_stride,
dedisp_byte *  out,
dedisp_size  out_nbits,
dedisp_size  out_stride,
unsigned  flags 
)

dedisp_execute_adv executes a plan to dedisperse the given array of data.

Parameters:
planThe plan to execute.
nsampsThe length in samples of each input time series.
inPointer to an array containing a time series of length nsamps for each frequency channel in plan. The data must be in time-major order, i.e., frequency is the fastest-changing dimension, time the slowest.
in_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the input data. Currently supported values are: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32
in_strideThe stride of the array in in bytes. Must be >= channel_count * in_nbits/8, where channel_count is the value given by dedisp_get_channel_count(plan).
outPointer to an array of length out_stride*dm_count bytes, where dm_count is the value given by dedisp_get_dm_count(plan). The output order is DM-major, i.e., time is the fastest-changing dimension, DM the slowest.
out_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the output data. Currently supported values are: 8 (uchar), 16 (ushort), 32 (float)
out_strideThe stride of the array out in bytes. Must be >= (nsamps - max_delay) * out_nbits/8, where max_delay is the value given by dedisp_get_max_delay(plan).
flagsConfiguration flags, interpreted as follows:
0 or DEDISP_USE_DEFAULT: Use the default configuration.
DEDISP_HOST_POINTERS (default): The pointers in and out point to arrays on the host.
DEDISP_DEVICE_POINTERS: The pointers in and out point to arrays on the device.
DEDISP_WAIT (default): Force the function to wait until the computation is complete before returning.
DEDISP_ASYNC: Allow the function to return before the computation is complete. The dedisp_sync function can later be used to wait until the computation is complete.
Flags may be combined using the | operator.
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_INVALID_POINTER, DEDISP_INVALID_STRIDE, DEDISP_NO_DM_LIST_SET, DEDISP_TOO_FEW_NSAMPS, DEDISP_INVALID_FLAG_COMBINATION, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_IN_NBITS, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_OUT_NBITS, DEDISP_INTERNAL_GPU_ERROR, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
Note:
This function assumes one wishes to compute all DMs in the DM list. To compute only a subset of the DM list, use dedisp_execute_guru.
dedisp_error dedisp_execute_guru ( const dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_size  nsamps,
const dedisp_byte *  in,
dedisp_size  in_nbits,
dedisp_size  in_stride,
dedisp_byte *  out,
dedisp_size  out_nbits,
dedisp_size  out_stride,
dedisp_size  first_dm_idx,
dedisp_size  dm_count,
unsigned  flags 
)

dedisp_execute_guru executes a plan to dedisperse the given array of data.

Warning:
This function is experimental and may contain bugs.
Bug:
This function cannot be used in conjunction with adaptive time resolution.
Parameters:
planThe plan to execute.
nsampsThe length in samples of each input time series.
inPointer to an array containing a time series of length nsamps for each frequency channel in plan. The data must be in time-major order, i.e., frequency is the fastest-changing dimension, time the slowest.
in_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the input data. Currently supported values are: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32
in_strideThe stride of the array in in bytes. Must be >= channel_count, where channel_count is the value given by dedisp_get_channel_count(plan).
outPointer to an array of length out_stride*dm_count bytes, where dm_count is the value given by dedisp_get_dm_count(plan). The output order is DM-major, i.e., time is the fastest-changing dimension, DM the slowest.
out_nbitsThe number of bits per sample in the output data. Currently supported values are: 8 (uchar), 16 (ushort), 32 (float)
out_strideThe stride of the array out in bytes. Must be >= (nsamps - max_delay) * out_nbits/8, where max_delay is the value given by dedisp_get_max_delay(plan).
first_dm_idxThe (0-based) index at which to start within the DM list.
dm_countThe number of DMs to compute from the DM list.
flagsConfiguration flags, interpreted as follows:
0 or DEDISP_USE_DEFAULT: Use the default configuration.
DEDISP_HOST_POINTERS (default): The pointers in and out point to arrays on the host.
DEDISP_DEVICE_POINTERS: The pointers in and out point to arrays on the device.
DEDISP_WAIT (default): Force the function to wait until the computation is complete before returning.
DEDISP_ASYNC: Allow the function to return before the computation is complete. The dedisp_sync function can later be used to wait until the computation is complete.
Flags may be combined using the | operator.
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_INVALID_POINTER, DEDISP_INVALID_STRIDE, DEDISP_NO_DM_LIST_SET, DEDISP_TOO_FEW_NSAMPS, DEDISP_INVALID_FLAG_COMBINATION, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_IN_NBITS, DEDISP_UNSUPPORTED_OUT_NBITS, DEDISP_INTERNAL_GPU_ERROR, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
dedisp_error dedisp_generate_dm_list ( dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_float  dm_start,
dedisp_float  dm_end,
dedisp_float  pulse_width,
dedisp_float  tol 
)

dedisp_generate_dm_list generates a list of dispersion measures to be computed during dedispersion

Parameters:
planPlan object to generate DM list for.
dm_startThe lowest DM to use, in pc cm^-3.
dm_endThe highest DM to use, in pc cm^-3.
pulse_widthThe expected intrinsic width of the pulse signal in microseconds.
tolThe smearing tolerance factor between DM trials (a typical value is 1.25).
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_MEM_ALLOC_FAILED, DEDISP_MEM_COPY_FAILED, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
Note:
The number of DMs generated can be obtained using dedisp_get_dm_count(plan).

dedisp_get_channel_count gets the number of frequency channels in a plan.

Returns:
The number of frequency channels in plan.

dedisp_get_df gets the difference in frequency between two consecutive channels for a plan.

Returns:
The difference in frequency between two consecutive channels for plan.
dedisp_size dedisp_get_dm_count ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_dm_count gets the number of dispersion measures in a plan.

Returns:
The number of dispersion measures in plan.
const dedisp_float* dedisp_get_dm_list ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_dm_list gets the list of dispersion measures in a plan.

Returns:
Pointer to an array of dispersion measures in plan.
Note:
This function returns a host pointer, not a device pointer.
dedisp_float dedisp_get_dt ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_dt gets the difference in time between two consecutive samples for a plan.

Returns:
The difference in time between two consecutive samples for plan.
const dedisp_size* dedisp_get_dt_factors ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_dt_factors returns an array of length dedisp_get_dm_count(plan) containing the integer factors by which the time resolution (1/dt) is decreased for each DM. Note that the factors are guaranteed to be monotonically increasing powers of two.

Parameters:
planThe plan from which to get the values.
Returns:
A pointer to an array of integer factors.
Note:
A DM list for plan must exist prior to calling this function.
This function may safely be called even when dedisp_enable_adaptive_dt has not been called; in such cases the returned list will consist entirely of ones.
const char* dedisp_get_error_string ( dedisp_error  error)

dedisp_get_error_string gives a human-readable description of a given error code.

Parameters:
errorThe error code to describe.
Returns:
A string describing the error code.
dedisp_float dedisp_get_f0 ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_f0 gets the frequency of the first channel for a plan.

Returns:
The frequency of the first channel for plan.
dedisp_size dedisp_get_gulp_size ( dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_gulp_size gets the internal gulp size used by the library

Parameters:
planPlan object to set gulp size of
Returns:
The internal gulp size used by the library (arbitrary units, default: 131072)
const dedisp_bool* dedisp_get_killmask ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_killmask gets the killmask used in a plan.

Returns:
Pointer to an array of killmask values in plan.
Note:
This function returns a host pointer, not a device pointer.
dedisp_size dedisp_get_max_delay ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_get_max_delay gets the maximum delay (in samples) applied during dedispersion. During dedispersion, the last max_delay samples are required for the computation of other samples, but are not themselves dedispersed.

Returns:
The maximum delay that is applied during execution of plan.
Note:
A DM list for plan must exist prior to calling this function.
dedisp_error dedisp_set_device ( int  device_idx)

dedisp_set_device sets the GPU device to be used by the library

Parameters:
device_idxThe index of the device to use
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_DEVICE_INDEX, DEDISP_DEVICE_ALREADY_SET, DEDISP_UNKNOWN_ERROR, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
Note:
If this function is not called, the system-defined default device will be used.
This function must be called before any other dedisp library calls.
This function can only be called once.
dedisp_error dedisp_set_dm_list ( dedisp_plan  plan,
const dedisp_float *  dm_list,
dedisp_size  count 
)

dedisp_set_dm_list sets a list of dispersion measures to be computed during dedispersion

Parameters:
planPlan object to apply dm list to.
dm_listArray containing dispersion measures to be computed (in pc cm^-3).
countNumber of dispersion measures.
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_INVALID_POINTER, DEDISP_MEM_ALLOC_FAILED, DEDISP_MEM_COPY_FAILED, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
Note:
dm_list must be an array on the host, i.e., it must not be a device array
One of either this function or dedisp_generate_dm_list must be called prior to calling dedisp_execute.
dedisp_error dedisp_set_gulp_size ( dedisp_plan  plan,
dedisp_size  gulp_size 
)

dedisp_set_gulp_size sets the internal gulp size used by the library

Parameters:
planPlan object to set gulp size of
gulp_sizeThe new internal gulp size (arbitrary units, default: 131072)
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_NO_ERROR
Note:
If this function is not called, the default gulp size (131072) is used.
dedisp_error dedisp_set_killmask ( dedisp_plan  plan,
const dedisp_bool *  killmask 
)

dedisp_set_killmask sets a list of channels to ignore when dedispersing

Parameters:
planPlan object to apply killmask to
killmaskArray containing one value per channel. 0=>ignore channel, 1=>include channel.
Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_INVALID_PLAN, DEDISP_MEM_COPY_FAILED, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR, DEDISP_NO_ERROR
Note:
killmask must be an array on the host, i.e., it must not be a device array
Passing killmask=NULL sets a blank killmask, i.e., no channels are ignored.
dedisp_error dedisp_sync ( void  )

dedisp_sync waits until all previous plan executions have completed before returning. This function can be used in conjunction with the DEDISP_ASYNC flag in dedisp_execute to overlap computation on the host and the device.

Returns:
One of the following error codes:
DEDISP_NO_ERROR, DEDISP_PRIOR_GPU_ERROR
dedisp_bool dedisp_using_adaptive_dt ( const dedisp_plan  plan)

dedisp_using_adaptive_dt returns whether plan has adaptive time resolution enabled.

Parameters:
planThe plan for which to query adaptive time resolution.
